dialogues.text: She turns, runs to the door.  Like a trapped bird.  She t door -- locked.  A window -- locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't run away. I forgive you,  Emma. I know you left me. But  I still love you. Do you still have  my ring? I need it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter grabs hold of Emma.  She pulls away.  Emma sees his with her.  Seductive yet nightmarish. As if hallucinating, Emma runs away, towards -- The big window overlooking the gardens.  She runs, leaps, Crashes thru the GLASS, shards and splinters SHATTERING a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: somersaults through the window down to the ground.  Lands ground.  Looks up to see -- Steed above her, the STORM RAGING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She struggles to her feet, comes towards him, upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no. First time, shame on you. Third time, shame on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slugs her and the SCREEN GOES BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diagnosis confirmed.  Mrs. Peel is  suffering from delusions and  hallucinations. An extreme personality  disorder. She imagines her husband  Peter Peel has come back to her ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Emma's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A classic syndrome, to overcome her  subconscious guilt at her other crimes.   We've attached her to the dreamscape  machine. We'll soon see what her  unconscious looks like...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma's eyes flicker... Steed comes INTO FOCUS, sitting by Emma's bed.  This time Emma looks around ... Everything blurs.  A STEADY PULSE D leather straps.  No use.  WIDEN to reveal Emma strapped t Her head surrounded by a plastic dome, terminals and wire Dreamscape machine.  Drowsy, disoriented.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where am I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Winslow Home for Retired Lepidoptorists. I'm so sorry I struck you, Mrs. Peel. Please forgive me. I thought you were someone else ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (no smile) I expect that's for you to know and me to find out ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was Peter -- I saw him ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drugged, Emma's eyes drop.  FOCUS CHANGES TO --

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE HER
dialogues.text: A giant spiral HYPNODISC WHIRRS, creating trippy black an effects a la Bridget Riley. She blinks.

dialogues.speaker: SAME SCENE
dialogues.text: Steed is gone.  Dr. Darling leans over her.  Emma stares eyes.

dialogues.speaker: HER EYES
dialogues.text: Thousand REMs per sec -- a tiny chip next to her eyes, tr

dialogues.speaker: UP ON WALL
dialogues.text: A "Dreamscape" apparatus like a liquid TV screen flicks t Emma's unconscious.  Peter Peel -- Teddy Bears -- post ca snaps --

dialogues.speaker: BESIDE "BED"
dialogues.text: Dr. Darling furls his hand over Emma's, his fingers resti interrogation, he soothingly strokes her hand -- tries to arousing her suspicion.  Pulls gently on it.

dialogues.speaker: UP IN GALLERY
dialogues.text: In his wheelchair, Mother sits beside Steed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This man -- did you see him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Her husband, she says. Alice tried to warn us. A trap. Tell Mother beware. Tell Father That's all.

dialogues.speaker: BY COUCH
dialogues.text: Dr. Darling leans forward to interrogate Emma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks and sounds sinister.  From a corner of her eye, hanging from his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to say the first thing that comes into your head when I say these words. Do you understand ... ? (as she nods) Blue ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... bottle ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... head ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knight ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... death ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... death ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed watching, listening ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flower ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... power ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The exchange speeds up.  Unknown to Dr. Darling, Emma pic straps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nature ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... preserve...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Secret ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... love...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... love ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fear ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... love ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Emma talks, the "Dreamscape" plucks images from her un psychedelic rush:  faces -- colors -- patterns flash past

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Piper picked a peck of pickled  peppers how many pecks of pickled  peppers did Peter Peel -- ?

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: Quietly unclicks a lock.  She stops in mid-gabble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have I been here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma unlocks her straps.  Sits Up.  Woozy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you get paid by the hour?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Darling is shocked, indignant.  Emma rips wires from machine winds down.  Up in the gallery -- BAM -- !  Mother bashes his metal cane on the railings

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) You are here under observation,  Mrs. Peel. You must answer Dr.  Darling's questions

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pushes Dr. Darling aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I resign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) You need treatment, Mrs. Peel.  You can't resign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma staggers.  Mother looks at Steed.  Who snaps himself hypnodisc. Emma heads for the airlock door marked:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't open that, Mrs. Peel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fat chance ... she goes in ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma floats in the air, as Mother, Dr. Darling and Steed helplessly, turning around madly.  Trying to gain on Emma Steed's umbrella and bowler, all tumble thru the air as S switch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (echoing) What are you trying to do to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flailing) We want to help...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I was a widow. My husband ... the only man I ever loved ... is dead. For the rest of my life I have to live with that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The death of Peter Peel was a great loss. To us all ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To you ... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother looks at Emma.  He's let the cat out the bag.  Ste They all tumble to the floor, Mother landing perfectly in Steed effortlessly catching his hat and umbrella.  He mov

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you owe Mrs. Peel an explanation ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed stares Mother out.  Who delivers his revelations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter Peel was a first class agent. A senior operative. 'X' department Special operations.   He was engaged in top secret research.   Top priority.  Government approved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Institute ... the funding ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cover ... for us. (beat) I'm sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A turning moment for Emma.  A life lived on a lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So all that time. Our work, our research  was for you ... for this? And the  accident --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was no accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The official investigation ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... was written by me. (beat) It was sabotage, Mrs. Peel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deadly serious, Emma walks over to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite frankly ... it could have been you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.  Emma looks away, shocked.  Steed intervenes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're accusing Mrs. Peel of killing her own husband?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her husband suspected someone very  close to the operation. On the day he  died, he was setting a test. To prove to himself -- to us that his  wife was beyond suspicion. He had to  be certain. He said he was going to  give Mrs. Peel something ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma keeps staring at Mother, fingers her diamond ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I want you to remember. Did Peter give you anything on-that  day?

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: touches her ring.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Emma looks up at Mother.  A barefaced lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed notices Emma touch her ring nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said if it vanished, he'd know it was ... you who betrayed him. He took a huge risk. The ultimate test.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I'm still ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under suspicion. Everyone died in  the explosion, Mrs. Peel. You were  the only survivor ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother waits.  Emma turns round.  Looks fiercely at him. Emma walks past him to the airlock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is an official matter, Mrs. Peel. No need to take it personally. Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To find out who killed my husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors and walls are monitored,  Mrs. Peel. This is a very secure  establishment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So am I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma pushes open the doors.  Walks out.  Down a corridor. Mother, as he exits with Steed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She must remain here. She's highly dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: IN HALL
dialogues.text: Mother exits with Steed; they watch Emma going ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pity. I was growing fond of Mrs. Peel. Unfortunately --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guilty until proven innocent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother and Father know best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother wheels himself off.  Then stops; over his shoulder

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something quick. Nothing too ... messy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON Steed.  CAR ROAR over as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma drives a hot-wired Morris Minor out the open gates o sign which reads: "WINSLOW HOME FOR RETIRED LEPIDOPTORISTS" (Butterfly logo In the b.g., a couple of old-timers race around with butt past them in hot pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma speeds down lanes ... Followed at a safe distance by Steed in his SS100.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed looks: a bleep on his radar screen tracks the --

dialogues.speaker: CONCEALED MICRO-BUG
dialogues.text: on Emma's shoulder as she drives ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cars whiz past ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keeping an eye on his radar and the road, Steed switches forecast:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) '... Sunny intervals leading to sudden storms and gale warnings for all areas. (as he frowns) ... Outbursts of rain, scattered hailstorms and freezing fog greeted the World Council of Ministers as they arrived in London for their conference ...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma drives into a churchyard.  Steed follows her ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A medieval country church.  Sunlight streams through stai as Steed watches her lay -- A red rose by an altar tomb:  an ornate mausoleum two han eternal sleep:  Peter Peel. Emma pauses, as in the b.g., choirboys sing hymn practice away, toward the door.  He drops a hymn book.  Emma swive

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You followed me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To kill me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fractional pause) Nothing personal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma smiles. Then turns, and -- Runs!  Steed follows Emma through a door to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed enters, glimpses -- Emma above.  He follows her.  Hears her footsteps.  Trip- staircase.  Steed listens, follows.

dialogues.speaker: UP BELLTOWER
dialogues.text: From below, Steed hears a BELL RING.  A FLUTTER of BIRDS. down -- Steed runs up stairs, reaches --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BELL still RINGING.  At the top, a sheer drop.  Steed edg Looks.  A long way down. From behind --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long way down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed swivels.  Sees Emma blocking his path.  Cool menace the edge, Emma circles him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful. You might fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma steps to the edge.  Steed freezes.  Emma locks down. Rocking to and fro ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could save you the trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you always obey orders ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always. (pause) Except ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed nears her.  Emma pushes herself right to the edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes ... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... when I don't. It comes down to one  thing, Mrs. Peel. Trust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed reaches out for her.  Holds out his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And do you trust me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could be convinced, if ... I knew who  poisoned me in the maze. That kiss ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't me; you have my word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed snatches her from the edge, holds her in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need proof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma thinks.  Looks at him.  Deadly serious.  Their eyes pecks him on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was longer. On the lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma hesitates.  Then a kiss on the lips.  Longer.  But n hand, pulls her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Much longer.  Approximately ... fifteen seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma harumphs, exasperated.  Moves closer to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed nods.  Emma leans forward.  A full kiss.  At first watch.  Counts seconds ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Four ... seven ... ni-...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then ... forgets.  Warmer, more relenting.  Edging toward embracing for fifteen seconds ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aroused) Mmm ... what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keeping a stiff upper lip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kiss continues couple of seconds longer.  Before Emma she regains her composure.  A long silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I'm in the clear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed savors the kiss.  No reply.  His smile says it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you did suspect me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're playing games.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't we all, Mrs. Peel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you played by the rules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm playing to win.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winning isn't everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't tell me it's how you play the game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles; stands aside) After you -- Mrs. Peel ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed motions down the stairs.  It's close to the edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, after you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (back to square one) You don't trust me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As far as you trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma motions.  Steed goes down, passes close to the edge, nervously.  Emma reads his thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When it happens, Steed, you'll be the first to know ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With this comforting thought, Steed descends first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Steed and Emma exit from the tower, they see -- A tranquil village scene.  Choirboys walk out from the ch village street.  A red PHONE BOX.  Which ... RING-RING ... Starts to RING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who could that be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ROLL of THUNDER.  Steed looks up: a clear sky.  He's pu suspicious.  As Emma moves to the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- don't answer it ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls her back.  Emma looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it. The phones trigger the explosions --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RING-RING ... Another ROLL of THUNDER.  Steed connects th angelic CHOIRBOY walks towards the phone ... RING-RING ... A LOUDER ROLL of THUNDER.  As the Choirboy PHONE, Steed shouts --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't -- don't answer it -- !

dialogues.speaker: PHONE
dialogues.text: RING-RING -- the PHONE in the f.g. as the choirboy closes

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE PHONE BOX
dialogues.text: The door shuts.  Noise muffled.  The Choirboy can't hear warnings, as he lifts his hand up, and --

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: Steed sees him reach out, warns the vicar and choirboys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get down -- get down -- it's going to explode -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed and Emma, all the choirboys hit the dirt, as

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE PHONE BOX
dialogues.text: The Choirboy grabs the phone, and lifts it up, and Silence. No explosion.  A few seconds pass.  Steed and everyone are down on the ground.  As they see --

dialogues.speaker: FROM PHONE BOX
dialogues.text: -- the Choirboy leaves the phone hanging.  He gets out, s calmly over to Steed, who's still prone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vicar and choirboys look on sympathetically, as -- Steed dusts himself off.  Emma and everyone gets up.  Ste takes the call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother? How did you find me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His expression changes as he listens.  Emma goes to the p He emerges from the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told Mother I took care of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I equivocated. But you're not their big worry at present. It's Dr. Darling:  he's disappeared ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFF Emma's reaction to this news --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the upper room, in front of a mirror -- With his back turned to us.  Dr. Darling holds something

dialogues.speaker: DOWN LONG HALL
dialogues.text: Bad "Emma" walks over.  She stands in front of him. Blank expression.  Dr. Darling hardly even looks up.  Wit on her neck a tattoo:  Z424.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are in the final phase. I shall require  you to be especially obedient. There  must be no failures.

dialogues.speaker: IN HIS HANDS
dialogues.text: which he grips tightly. As --

dialogues.speaker: IN MIRROR
dialogues.text: a metamorphosis.  His features melt and bubble, a mask of slipping around like Michael Jackson's face under kleig l Shakes the snowshaker ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUNDER as the sky darkens -- PAN DOWN to reveal: Steed's Jag, zooming through country lanes.  Rain starts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed driving, winces with the drizzle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drat. Someone wants to implicate you in this affair, Mrs. Peel. Any idea who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No idea who. No idea why ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinks) Teddy bears, cuckoo clocks, toys All children's things ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Or grown-ups, who still like to be children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite. Any childhood friends? Enemies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not to speak of. Peter and I were both loners. There was nobody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed thinks; sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well. I have a friend who might be of assistance. He's at the Ministry. We'd better be careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a wanted woman, I know ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through a door marked "Information & Counter Espionag -- walks Steed with another man in identical clothes:  da and bowler.  Which is Emma Peel, in disguise.  Steed furtively checks passers-b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name's Jones. 'Invisible' Jones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why's he called 'Invisible'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At a door marked "Information -- Col. I. Jones." Steed kn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll catch you up. Don't worry; he's expecting you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma goes in as Steed walks down the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A room full of archives and files.  Emma walks through ta full of old paper. Dusty, musty and mildewing.  Long forgotten.  Nobody ther hears -- FOOTSTEPS. She follows them.  Round stacks, round corners.  The FOOT She's closing in.  The FOOTSTEPS get LOUDER, until up ahe A filing cabinet drawer opens up.  On its own. Emma watches as a file pops up, floats through air.  The nobody there.  Emma follows the file to a -- Desk.  Emma watches as -- the chair swivels round.  The f phone lifts up by itself, a voice:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell Miss Proudfoot, no calls. (beat) Colonel Jones at your service, Mrs. Peel. Just a moment --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma looks ahead of her.  To the chair. As -- A desk drawer opens up, a pipe is whisked through the air lights; smoke belches forth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to the pipe, Mrs. Peel. That usually helps. Don't worry about me being invisible. Other than that I'm perfectly normal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or rather, you don't. Learnt the tricks in camouflage. Till this accident made a prang of things. How can I help you, Mrs. Peel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say, Trubshaw, Steed here ... Barometer's falling fast. Mrs. Peel and I find ourselves in need of foul weather gear. (beat) Yes, I'd say gentlemen's snuff for starters. And then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: File pages flip through the air as Jones goes through the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, here we are. Steed asked me to play a hunch:  Valentine Peel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter's brother?  But --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half-brother to be precise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma is surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now let's see ... Eton, Cambridge ...  research into robotics and plastics.   Overtaken by Peter's work on the  physics of climate change ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know all this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you also know that during your  final experiment, your halfbrother- in-law was under surveillance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surveillance? By whom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father. She gave him an 'all clear'  after a security test by Dr. Darling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's now vanished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Makes two of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you suggesting that Dr. Darling  and Valentine were somehow in this  together? But that's absurd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed enters behind them on the run --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must hurry, Mrs. Peel ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry?  What for?  I'm just now --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't tell her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (testy) I was getting to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Getting to what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The World Council of Ministers meets  tomorrow to convene the new global  defense initiative --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fail to see --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a reception this evening. Colonel  Jones thinks it advisable we attend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have we been invited?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (poker-voiced) Under the circumstances Mother didn't  see fit, but I think I can get you in ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surveys her male outfit) Well, I can't possibly go like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a feeling. That's why we're  in a hurry ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed proffers an arm to Emma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I have the honor, Mrs. Peel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She decides, takes his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may, Mr. Steed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The A-team is born.  Steed and Emma tip their hats to Jon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troops rushing in to take up defense positions.  Searchli protective ring of hardware surrounds the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the controls, Brenda looks on.  She hands a bag of jel picks out his favorites, as he gives a briefing to Father passenger seats -- ORDERS BARKED OUTSIDE as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside that hall are some of the Most powerful figures in the world. Tight security. Our only option.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see to it personally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenda glances over at Father's imperturbable face. As --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wind picking up.  Outside the grand palace hall for the r of Ministers, guards stand on duty.  Barriers, flashing l except --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up in the gallery, Steed and Emma enter through a secret He with bowler and umbrella.  She in black leather and bo a niche and freeze, very close to one another.  Steed sni

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that you're wearing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's called Black Leather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Intoxicating. Here, have one of these.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He fumbles with a bulging jacket pocket

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Limpet bomb. Small, very compact. From Trubshaw's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hocks it on belt) When all this is over, we simply must get you out of that suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leads the way through marble halls, arched galleries, chandeliers.  From the hall, a SPEECH ECHOES:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... In the uncertain climate that threatens  this global initiative, no magic umbrella  can shield us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed checks out his own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only our own vigilance. Security and  stability are our watchwords.

dialogues.speaker: APPLAUSE.
dialogues.text: Steed pauses, offers Emma a small silver box.  Inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trubshaw again? What now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snuff. (off Emma's lock) I must insist you try some.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed takes some; Emma follows his example.  Weird.  Does walk on, open doors to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An empty gallery.  Steed and Emma peer down at a --

dialogues.speaker: MARBLE HALLWAY
dialogues.text: A black and white floor.  Butlers move across like surrea empty.  A chamber ensemble plays "The Merry Widow" waltz, empty halls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're playing your song, Mrs. Peel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed) 'The Merry Widow?' I might have known. Where's the reception?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move cautiously forward as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside, snow begins to fall.  Trees and buildings shimme A Christmassy glow -- Even troops play with snowflakes, until --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wind rises.  The snow falls harder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down in the hallway, Steed and Emma search for the Minist corridor, then hear a NOISE.  They hide behind pillers. A Butlers walk past in military file, carrying elaborate di Steed steals -- A chicken leg.  Nibbles on it.  Suddenly another door ope looks up to see -- Father "staring" at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hello ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We want Mrs. Peel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead, I'm afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma in hiding, listens as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You disobeyed an order, Steed.   Mrs. Peel is dangerous; she cannot  be trusted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma looks out the window behind her; eyes widen ... back

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think she can. (beat) Can you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma is deeply affected by Steed's choice. Father's face, meantime, has turned to stone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shall summon security.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns, almost walks into the door as she slips away. Emma returns as the ALARM is raised --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad news. Father's looking for you.   Where are those bloody ministers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a look at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leads him to the window:  sure enough -- heavy snow. Steed reacts, eyes wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's almost May, for heaven sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blizzard rages through streets -- Now impassable.  Snow drifts block roads.  White mountain shop fronts.  And amid the sky -- Filled with snowflakes, up round the roofs, a purple clou troops --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed returns, rushes across the marble halls -- To Emma. But up ahead, sees --

dialogues.speaker: FROM WINDOWS
dialogues.text: A purple fog seeping into the hallway, billowing through

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside an anteroom, like a Roman arena -- marble pillars, ceiling murals -- The World Council ministers assemble:  slick pin-striped Mao-suits, Indian Nehru-jackets, all distinguished men an Fussing officials, minor dignitaries, and butlers, bowing diplomatic protocol, interrupted by --

dialogues.speaker: CENTER OF HALL
dialogues.text: The sight of Emma Peel in black leather. She strides into the room.  Picks a glass of champagne fr Emma raises her glass --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, ladies. Forgive the breach  of protocol. An emergency --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the hallway -- BOOM -- !  The door bursts open, Emma blast as the purple cloud races inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the smoke furls around the ministers, they choke, fall From the doors -- Steed leaps in, gives Emma another snor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick --it'll protect you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma inhales.  Now immune to the gas, Steed and Emma hear see -- through thick cloud -a mysterious man in a white l leading a group of butlers, all in gas masks -- heads lik round the ministers, helpless on the floor.  A kidnapping The man and butlers haul away several ministers, and -- Escape from the rear doors.  The butlers form a guard to Steed and Emma run after them.  More butlers pursue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As troops roll helplessly in the snow-covered purple haze onto waiting choppers as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother, Brenda, et al choke on purple smoke in the bus ..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind pillars, Steed and Emma hide as -- Butlers in gas masks patrol the halls.  A butler passes t to emerge.  But another patrols -- Steed trips the butler with his umbrella, then chops him but Emma kicks him into as -- Behind them Steed sees the lab-coated man escape up the s of butlers.  He shouts --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After him, Mrs. Peel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A whole posse of butlers then advances.  Steed faces them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma hesitates.  Then turns, heads for an ornate dual sha button, gets inside, doors shut, as the BULLETS from MACH masked butlers strike the brass door as -- Steed whips his rapier from his umbrella and duels with t time, he uses every trick and prop at his disposal, plus, Kick, chop, punch, and impale them into submission, as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The posse of butlers fan out on to keep pace with Emma. elevator "CALL" buttons on every floor, as --

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE ELEVATOR
dialogues.text: Emma waits inside.  Until she reaches --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doors open.  A HAIL of BULLETS hit the lift as Emma hides doors close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma sighs with relief.  COOL HUM as the ELEVATOR rises.

dialogues.speaker: ON STAIRS
dialogues.text: Steed gaining on the butlers, heading for the stairs, as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the next floor, the doors open -- Two butlers rush inside.  BLAM -- !  Emma cuts one in the punch,  then -- Punches -- kicks -- stabs the other butler, a more brutis grab Emma by the throat. She chokes, breaks his stranglehold, swerves him round, g arms and throat -- And a knee in his back in time for -- PING!  The BELL RINGS at -- 3rd floor where -- Emma spins her captive butler round, in time to face -- Whooomph!  a blast of fire from -- A flamethrower launched in the hall. Aaargh -- !  The butler gets fried, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shields Emma from the worst of the blast. She  hurls him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slam shut.  COOL HUM ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed continues his one-sided duel with the other butlers get upstairs to help Emma...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up Emma goes.  Looks for an escape route.  Bangs on the w secret panels.  The "floor" light flickers between floors Waiting, until ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors open.  A grenade is hurled inside the doors, it dives to the other side, then -- Scrambles for the grenade.  Picks it up.  It slips out of slips out ... Just beyond the elevator doors.  Which start to shut.  Em grenade towards the butlers, and -- As her elevator doors close -- BOOM -- !  It EXPLODES among the butlers, one of whom -- Rushes to --

dialogues.speaker: ELEVATOR, (5TH FLOOR)
dialogues.text: Where he waits for the elevator.  Removes pin.  Grenade r Doors open.  About to throw it inside, when --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Emma.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: The butler hesitates.  Looks inside.  Still no Emma?  He The doors shut; he jams his foot.  The doors open again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and looks round.  Nobody there.  Until, as we -- PULL BACK UP to reveal -- FROM ABOVE, spread-eagled like roof, limbs flexed against the walls is -- Emma, who -- drops down and -- Scissors the butler's head between her legs. The grenade rolls free ... Emma twists around, grabs his ears, and -- Sits on his face.  Buries his head in her crotch.  A muff Emma scissor kicks, breaking his neck.  She drags --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His head out.  Leaving his neck between the doors.  So as the stairs, the elevators doors. SLAM! And -- BOOM!  His GRENADE rocks the elevator, which

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breaks from its ropes, and -- Plummets down the elevator shaft, shaking the building as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything shakes with the impact of the elevator as Stee step, throwing gas-masked butlers over his shoulder as he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up the winding staircase, at the top, a skylight, which - Flips open.  The man leaps out, throwing back inside a sm skylight.  As the grenade --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM!  explodes in the narrow staircase, fills it with pu thru smoke, choking.  She gets to the skylight, tries to A moment's panic.  Then Emma -- punches a hole in the gla the skylight up, and -- Emerges into the night air.  Snowflakes tumble around her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blades whirling.  Amid the blizzard, the man ready to esc whirly chopper ... Another assassin attacks Emma, pins her on her back, over before her -- Emma held back over gargoyle, over now snow white city .. Flicks him backwards ... As his body hurtles down into the snow-covered streets, E But too late:  sees -- The chopper -- about to take off.

dialogues.speaker: FROM INSIDE CHOPPER
dialogues.text: The gas-masked MAN in the white lab coat:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Mrs. Peel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chopper rises slowly. Emma looks.  A fifteen foot leap ... Impossible.

dialogues.speaker: FROM INSIDE CHOPPER
dialogues.text: A farewell wave from the gas-masked man.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: contemplating the jump, beneath falling snowflakes, as th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rope/chain ladder coils into the chopper's belly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Above London rooftops, after dark -- The man (still wears gas mask) the Pilot, CO-PILOT and a chopper, a giddy look down thru a glass command module. city. OVER the RADIO, interference.  A changing of stations.  T broadcast of "The Merry Widow." As the WALTZ serenades them high above the city  --  a KNOCKING from outside on the door -- Surprised reactions.  The Butler opens the door, sees -- Emma hanging onto the helicopter struts.  The Butler is t anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts, re:  the gas mask) Anyone ever tell you you look like a housefly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma grabs his epauletted shoulder, yanks him up, flicks The Butler is jerked out -- flies into the open air.  Emm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone else need a lift?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The white-coated Man moves forward, but Emma is out, slam clinging ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Pilot; intercom) Can't you throw her off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pilot nods, works controls, the chopper dips as -- Blam -- !  a kinky leather boot crashes -- Into the Pilot's face as Emma kicks in the GLASS from the SMASHES so the Pilots can't see -- a sudden rush of cold The INSTRUMENT PANELS WHIRR round as the Pilots struggle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intercom) Where'd she go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with the blades whirling directly over her head, Emma cra chopper and lets herself down the other side as London's As the Co-Pilot pokes his head out of the cockpit -- Emma grabs him with one hand, hoists him up into the air The Co-Pilot dangles over the city.  Grabs Emma.  Slither Pistol whips her.  Emma crunches back onto the metal.  Bl The co-Pilot peers into her eyes from inside the gas mask

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy landings, Mrs. Peel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises his hand, ready to hit her again, Emma yanks hi sliced off by the blades -- body and head fall away separ As Emma reacts, her legs are grabbed from below and the w down the side of the chopper -- Emma falls, but manages a flying handhold, hangs onto the chopper.  As --

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: The Pilot and his passenger zoom at low level over buildi Emma ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thru the blizzard, zooming down streets, landmark buildin snow, feet up ... shinnying up the chain wire ... "THE MERRY WIDOW WALTZ," no longer heard as old record or arrangement but enormous, for FULL ORCHESTRA ...

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: grimly hoists herself up along the struts again, hand ove cockpit from behind --

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: With a sudden movement, she yanks the Pilot out from behi towards eternity on his own. The chopper out of control as the white-coated Man is lef

dialogues.speaker: IN NIGHT AIR
dialogues.text: "THE MERRY WIDOW" BOOMS, the chopper lurches, spinning ro down, over spiraling corkscrews, an insane waltz ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The white-coated Man gets control ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zig-zags down a narrow street, trying to smash Emma into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Emma bounces of buildings, holding on for dear life ..

dialogues.speaker: THAMES
dialogues.text: The chopper dips down, dragging Emma through icy water .. Up ahead ... Tower Bridge ... twin peaks ... a firework d lights in the sky thru snowflakes ... Emma sees the bridge coming, reaches down and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detaches her pocket limpet bomb and lobs it into the chop

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bridge looms up, chopper rising to cross it as Emma l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Man sees the bomb ... Also flings himself onto the bridge as -- Against b.g. of the fireworks display --

dialogues.speaker: TOWER BRIDGE
dialogues.text: BOOM! -- the CHOPPER EXPLODES.  Ball of flames.  The crow appreciation ... great fireworks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma picks herself up, sees the Man in the white lab coat He runs too -- towards --

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER CHOPPER
dialogues.text: which unloads a rope ladder as Emma puts on every ounce o The Man reaches for the dangling ladder -- but --

dialogues.speaker: ON HIS FOOT
dialogues.text: stuck, wedged between narrow battlements.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: The Man looks at his shoe, at Emma charging towards him, pulls his foot out of his shoe and grabs the ladder, sail leaving Emma panting behind.  She's soaked, frozen, gaspi when she sees --

dialogues.speaker: SHOE
dialogues.text: Emma pulls it from its wedge, looks at the inside:  --  "

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it was Cinderella who lost her slipper ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Jermyn Street, snow lies waist high.  BLARING SIRENS. announcements urge citizens to stay indoors ... PULL BACK CLOCK TICKS calmly.  Emma sits with her shoe, surrounded Steed & Trubshaw beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time the shoe's on the other foot. You said a hand-made shoe was as good as a photo-fit or D.N.A.? Well, all we have to do is find the shoe that fits ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It should be easy. A Trubshaw client has his shoes delivered personally. The Ministry should be able to confirm our delivery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be back ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laying in supplies, Mrs. Peel weather  may get very nasty and I've no umbrella ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You needn't bother. I can't drag you  further into this. After all, I am still  the chief suspect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No bother. Mother and Father think I've joined you. I might as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (comes back) Oh, and by the way, I think it's about  time you got rid of that chip on your  shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you'd been through what I have, you wouldn't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed reaches and pulls off the micro-bug from her should

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A microtag. One of Mother's little toys. There you are. Free at last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tips his bowler off her surprised reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An armory.  Steed stands before racks of umbrellas, displ ivory handles, duck handles, you name it ... Steed hefts a few, as picky as a Samurai ...

dialogues.speaker: UPSTAIRS
dialogues.text: Emma surrounded by a mountain of shoes.  Triumphantly, sh lasts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prince Charming, I presume. Your name is ...

dialogues.speaker: WORN PAPER LABEL
dialogues.text: with the name:  DARLING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed selects his umbrella and we FOLLOW UP TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees only Trubshaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Mrs. Peel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She just left, sir. In a hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said you'd understand.

dialogues.speaker: ON STEED
dialogues.text: Worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, here we are ...

dialogues.speaker: PIP PUFFING IN MID-AIR
dialogues.text: WIDEN to reveal:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the archives, among leather volumes.  A file goes Emma ... As she reads.  A map is opened across a desk fro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'X' marks the spot. The shoes were  delivered to ... an island in Hyde Park. Surrounded by the Serpentine. On the  site of a former Ministry installation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Privately owned by ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me guess:  Wonderland Weather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good, Mrs. Peel ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shall need a small plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not venturing alone, surely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to find out who killed my husband. Will you take these documents to Steed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him I said ... goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: below the Thames as at the beginning. In darkest paranoia, Mother lies at the heart of his Laby flash emergency.  Panic.  Cakes piled up beside him, unea Brenda hands a phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother grabs the phone, furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Mrs. Peel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He signals frantically for Father to trace the call, but there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) I was hoping you could tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're getting yourself into terrible  trouble, my son. Weather's turning  very nasty -- and so am I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) I'm going to follow up on a hunch of  my own. If I'm right, Mrs. Peel is  innocent and you have a mole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabs mirror; searches his face) Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) In your operation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm warning you for the last time,  Steed: whoever's behind all this,  looks like Mrs. Peel, walks like  Mrs. Peel and kills like Mrs. Peel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLICK.  The line goes dead.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed?? (to Father) Find Mrs. Peel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenda smiles at the thought.  Father rises, grim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through mist, an ultralight plane zooms down -- From the parachute ...  Down, down, down through the mist ... Over parkland, the parachute floats down ... To an island Serpentine river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma lands, buries her parachute.  Walks towards a thick hops across on water lilies until she reaches land again. a thousand eyes.  A CLICK of CAMERAS. In the midst of the jungle, Emma sees --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A red phone box.  Emma frowns in recognition; goes inside Presses "Button B", and -- The floor goes down.  Emma goes down with it, into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Formerly a Ministry installation.  The "elevator" stops. Emma steps out into --

dialogues.speaker: LONG DARK CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: A GUARD patrols.  Emma pushes herself against a wall.  Th round, and Emma swivels into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door locks behind.  Alone, Emma stands warily. From nowhere, a chilling, disembodied voice.  Intimate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations, Mrs. Peel. You have  been a worthy opponent. You have  tracked us down. You are within an  ace of winning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't a game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite right, but we still make the rules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rules are made to be broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then who wins?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and I. Together. But first you  must confront your greatest enemy. Who could that be, Mrs. Peel?   The answer is obvious ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly lights! Emma is in a hall of mirrors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In every direction Emma turns, a thousand reflections of splintered into fragments as Emma spins, freaked and conf Emma turns into herself -- only herself drapes arms aroun lips. Bad Emma -- whose eyes stare into Emma's startled ones as away, staggers back; realizes too late.  The hallucinogen to her knees as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sees "herself" above her, before she -- falls unconscious

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed's Jag races, skids in bad weather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the wheel Steed, his face grim, concentrates on th next to him the snow shaker with little Emma inside --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As if in a dream, Emma awakes captive inside a bizarre ca Emma "swims" in viscous air,        suspended like a merm A face peering in:  Father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) Emma in Wonderland. Welcome, Mrs. Peel. (filtered) We've been expecting you. We hope  you'll enjoy your stay with us.  Decontamination is almost complete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decontamination -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you've a new wardrobe. He does want you to look attractive. (beat ) He tells me you're very beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma pounds the glass in frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, Mrs. Peel. We're hundreds of feet below ground. The Ministry made it impregnable. No one can save you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Steed drives towards it ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bathed in candlelight.  A romantic supper for two ... A door opens, admitting -- Emma. Dressed, coiffed, super- around, sees another door.  In search of escape she haste A giant rabbit -- the one we saw at the Teddy Bear meetin Emma gasps in surprise, moves back into the room as he ad head -- it's Dr. Darling!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma, my dear. How lovely you look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps out of the rest of his costume ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would that I could say the Same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, but you haven't see the real me. Watch closely ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls at his face, which bubbles and collapses as he w Emma's horrified expression, eyes widening as -- Dr. Darling turns into ... Peter!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darling Emma --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was you ... all the time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really. Not quite. I'm afraid you still don't see ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again he claws at his face, pulling, twisting ... Emma winces at the sight, her eyes popping out of her hea It's Valentine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valentine Peel ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: beneath Gothic turrets pupils in top hats and tails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I remember him quite well ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK THROUGH windows to reveal:  Steed and an OLD TE beautiful library.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is where he used to spend his days. We have an old photograph somewhere ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's flipping through yearbooks, then shows Steed --

dialogues.speaker: PHOTO
dialogues.text: of Valentine Peel on stage, in wizard's garb.  Made up as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolute wizard with makeup. His favorite roll from Shakespeare. Prospero ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'The Prospero Project...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... From The Tempest. A banished duke, ousted by his brother, marooned on a magic island. Who controlled the weather.

dialogues.speaker: STEED
dialogues.text: grim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'O Brave New World that hath such people in it.'

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO DINNER TABLE
dialogues.text: Emma frozen, sinks into a chair, staring ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darling Emma -- yes, we:  the true  genius behind the Prospero Project ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks around the dinner table as he talks ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you died -- in the explosion ...

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Twisting the dial.  PAN UP the arm to reveal Valentine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no. I arranged the explosion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A slight miscalculation -- my face  was burned beyond recognition. Fortunately my research into plastics  came in handy ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) Dr. Darling, Peter ... all you ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An unholy trinity ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stands) You killed my husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For starters. Of course I had to kill  the Teddy Bears, as well ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too many cooks --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spoil the majority shareholders. In  Wonderland Weather. I planned  everything, even the Ministry  recruiting you ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I found you. All the clues led me here ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. I planned that, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But -- why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You disappoint me, Emma.  Can't you guess? (moves toward her) For you. It was all for you ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cold) 'Our revels now are ended.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no, Emma. They've only just begun ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone hangs in the air -- with the smoking pipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shoes were delivered to an island  in the Serpentine - former Ministry  installation ... she said to tell you

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: goodbye. What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said it's not goodbye yet. Listen, I'm going to need some help. In a hurry ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicates supper) Think of this as your second wedding feast ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm already married ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come, come, you're a widow -- a most attractive widow. Now I think  of it, we'll need a bridesmaid. Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes a button.  Bad Emma enters.  Tattooed Z424.  Un

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My latest model. A compound of  plastics and sensor chips. A big  improvement on the old X404s. The poor thing is quite fond of me.  Emma, say hello to Emma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAD EMMA HISSES, a strange mix of STATIC and FEEDBACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I believe she's actually  jealous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valentine, listen to me ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, bridesmaid. Now what have I left out? Oh, yes, I know: the ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (covers her hand) Ring?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands very near her -- she's terrified -- then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How silly of me -- let me make you comfortable first ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he advances, ZOOM IN EXTREME CLOSEUP Emma's eye

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another ball, WIDEN to reveal, from the lake, an odd eigh emerges -- The ball lands on the shore.  From the inside, layer to reveal -- Steed, like an urban dandy in suit and bowler.  A rose in poking with his umbrella -- Deflates the inflatable plastic submarine.  Steed heads o peacock swivel towards him, as he heads into the jungle w

dialogues.speaker: RED PHONEBOX
dialogues.text: Steed picks up the phone.  Presses all the buttons until lowers, his eyes widen in surprise ...

dialogues.speaker: SARCOPHAGUS
dialogues.text: carved in Emma's likeness.  Lowered from the ceiling hydr

dialogues.speaker: ACTION
dialogues.text: as Valentine descends spiral steps to join it. Valentine opens the coffin to reveal Emma strapped within

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's better. I say, isn't this  where you came in? It's impenetrable, by the way ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're mad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Entirely. On the other hand (he advances towards her, smiling) Mad people get things done. Let me show you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed stealing down a corridor and -- hides, as a posse of guards rushes past, alerted by the p they pass, then reaches out his umbrella, and -- Nabs Father around the neck who was feeling her way after

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you guess?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You reek of Mrs. Peel's Black Leather ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was you who gave Valentine Peel his security clearance ... you're the mole who betrayed the Ministry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother betrayed me. She was  going to replace me with a younger  Father.  Errand boy that's all I was.   'Find Steed...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you found me. Have a sniff of  this, why don't you? Careful, the  scent can be overpowering ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holding Father securely, Steed forces her nose into his r rubber tube, sprays a Mist.  Father passes out.  Steed ri Sees -- A grille and removes it, climbs in and replaces it before and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: crawls forward through a mass of wires and plumbing -- until he hears a VOICE -- VALENTINE'S. Steed reaches another grille, through which he can see --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma's coffin, standing on end, like the Iron Maiden face Valentine explains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People expect weather to be free.  They're used to it. I call that a  denial of freedom. No freedom of  choice. An abuse of human rights.  They buy water, electricity, gas.  Why shouldn't they be able to buy  their own weather if they want to?  If they have a little incentive ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma reacts -- also Steed (unseen) behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Such as?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destruction of their local weather  systems. I can zap a thousand  Chernobyls into the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The result would be ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chaos. Transport paralysis. Crop  failure.  Economic disaster.   Frostbite or sunburn ... on a  massive scale.  You've seen a few samples...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what's stopping you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One very small thing. A diamond 'cyclone' chip. A thousand times more information on a fraction of the size. If I possess that, my powers would be unlimited. My dear half-brother was developing it. But he suspected sabotage. He gave the chip to ... you, 'Mrs.' Peel. I want you. But also your ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valentine takes her by the hand. Kisses --

dialogues.speaker: HER RING
dialogues.text: A diamond.  In the light, a patterned imprint.  ZOOM IN -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The missing piece of the jigsaw. I tried to get you to give it to me  as Peter; I tried to steal it from  you as Dr. Darling. As myself I'll  be a bit less subtle. (he slips it off her finger; holds it up) With this ring my plan will be complete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How Wagnerian ... Do you mean  to say you've waited all these  years because you couldn't create  a chip on your own? That would  have amused Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speaking of Peter, there's more good  news: You won't even have to change  your last name. You'll always be Mrs. Peel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are my choices?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Choices?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll never marry you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valentine is philosophical.  He spins the sarcophagus on lying in her coffin as he looks down at her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One out of two isn't bad. I'll keep you  alive, darling Emma. In a year or five,  you may change your mind. If you're  still in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valentine presses a button.  From the ceiling -- a surgic inches of her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This little toy gave me back my face. It can replace yours. What do you think? Medusa? Madame Defarge? Maggie Thatcher?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He marks an imaginary line round Emma's face. An ALARM BELL RINGS.  Emma reacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Darling, this is Father. We have an intruder. I repeat --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valentine switches off the PA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. That will be Steed. He followed  you. Please excuse me. I have work  to do. My most spectacular  performance. A ballet of clouds. It  was made for you. I want to give you  a heart, Emma. I want all of London  to see it. And now with this ... (flourishes ring) They will. (leans close) And for an encore: the biggest cyclone  in history will wipe the City from the  face of the earth. (winks) Shape of things to come, my darling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stuffs a gag into Emma's mouth and closes the coffin o Darkness. Immediately, Steed tries to force his way through the gri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blast. What to do? Mrs. Peel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't dare say her name too loud -- and there's no t that thing, anyway. He turns around in the tunnel -- heads the other way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonlight night.  Dark clouds approach like an army, spre

dialogues.text: MOISTURE SPITS and CRACKLES, static energy waiting to exp In the sky -- clouds join together like a genie from a la strange dark sensuous figure, half human, half dreamlike. That stalks the city....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed crawling.  A rat runs over him ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The things I do for England ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pitch dark, then -- Emma's coffin is opened and we see Bad Emma, looking down Bad Emma stares at her human double -- Emma: who looks im the gag.  Bad Emma removes it, she -- Runs a finger down Emma's body, inside a hole torn in the Blood.  Her flesh.  Her blood.  Fascinated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must let me go ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad Emma listens.  Gently lays her head on Emma's breast, the HEARTBEAT.  Ba-boom.  Ba-boom ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you understand? If he has me, he'll have no use for you ... he'll destroy you ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The words jolt Bad Emma back, remembering her mission.  S it at Emma's face!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad Emma hesitates, looks strangely human as -- 315     ANOTHER PART OF UNDERGROUND H.Q. The grille pops off and Steed emerges where the guards ar

dialogues.text: Oh, dear.

dialogues.text: No escape.  He takes off his bowler -- deftly removes a s the guards, and -- Hurls it ...

dialogues.text: run towards him, Steed swivels gracefully and - slams the sartorial knuckleduster -- wham -- !  One drops -- Bam -- to the ground.  Steed stoops down, picks up his hat, sees A dent in its steel top.  For the first time, Steed loses

dialogues.text: Start the countdown. Action stations. Five minutes ...

dialogues.text: The countdown starts, red digitals going backwards -- Colorized computer screens map out hostile weather fronts A COMPUTERIZED VOICE STARTS to COUNT.  The CLOCK TICKS. Father enters behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations. The clouds are on course ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To explode. London will be ashes.

dialogues.text: But all those people -- !

dialogues.text: Bad storm clouds advance over London ... black and furiou

dialogues.text: As shadows in a whirl of chemical matter.  An airborne CY static ELECTRICITY.  The black shape now -- Forming a sensuous female shape.  Like a dream wisp of .. Emma Peel with an hourglass figure.  While --

dialogues.text: Fly ...

dialogues.text: Chaos on all TV monitors as ... Valentine hastens down the spiral steps and opens Emma's Emma's there, still gagged.  Looks asleep.

dialogues.text: Steed rushes in, BOLTS the AIRLOCK behind.  Pounding on d He sees the timer racing backwards -- stands over the con to stop the program. Looks for the chip -- amongst all the rest it's like tryi water.

dialogues.text: John Steed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valentine Peel. I see you've gone  back to using your original face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last one you'll ever see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perish the thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valentine fulls forth a rapier from the wall.

dialogues.text: Did they tell you at Eton that I was fencing champion, too?

dialogues.text: Steed unsheathes his umbrella, revealing ditto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They said you were a very naughty  boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fight is on as the numbers grow smaller!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're better than I expected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was at Harrow ...

dialogues.text: But did they teach you this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valentine whacks the blade off Steed's umbrella handle. symbol.  Steed, dumbfounded. Valentine advances towards Steed -- Who points the umbrella at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bang-bang ... you're dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wish.

dialogues.text: He moves to close in, when ...

dialogues.text: from the muzzle, as a BULLET ZIPS out, and --

dialogues.text: One shot -- for emergencies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clutches wound) That's not playing by the rules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (echoes Emma!) Rules are made to be broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulls his own gun) If you say so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He FIRES again.  To the heart.  Valentine spins to the fl

dialogues.text: You said ... one shot.

dialogues.text: Did I? My mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed turns to the console, tries to figure out how to st the hatch opens again, revealing Emma.  Valentine pulls h

dialogues.text: Steed turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Peel -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valentine has Emma, a knife to her throat, stands over th

dialogues.text: Bullet-proof waistcoats -- just the  thing. I get mine from Trubshaw's.  We'll be off now, won't we, darling? (to Steed) We wouldn't want to miss the fireworks. Figure it out if you can,  Steed ...

dialogues.text: He's torn briefly, but there are thousands of lives at st module and starts pulling out chips, looking ...

dialogues.text: going down, down, down, as ...

dialogues.text: The cyclone picking up force ...

dialogues.text: pull up a chip.  The red numbers freeze.  WIDEN to reveal

dialogues.text: Troops pulling off gas masks as ...

dialogues.text: start flashing ... A different set of numbers start running backwards ...

dialogues.text: You must be joking ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fool ...

dialogues.text: That will do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's materialized across the girder from Valentine.  Who

dialogues.text: Aren't you forgetting about something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come, come. You don't really expect me to fall for --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh uh.  She holds him in a vice-like grip.  Hugging Valen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugh ...

They fall into the mists and liquid below. Steed almost falls himself as he grabs a beam for support

dialogues.text: Dead.

dialogues.text: Emma!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has said her name.  He scrambles down to her body. Emma lying sprawled out on the ground. Steed picks up her limp body in his arms like "Sleeping B tears.  He lays her down.

dialogues.text: Emma ...

dialogues.text: Kisses her.  A chaste kiss on the lips.  But with the for closes his eyes, looks away in grief.  The ALARM STILL SO give a damn. Behind, Emma opens her eyes.  As if revived by the kiss. him.

dialogues.text: Steed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed looks back at her -- surprise, delight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Peel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kept you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plot. (realizing) Hello, we must be going ...

dialogues.speaker: AUTO-DESTRUCT NUMBERS
dialogues.text: Racing backwards as ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed pulls Emma through the catwalks and corridors of Va

dialogues.speaker: MORE NUMBERS
dialogues.text: racing to zero, nothing to stop them ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed and Emma race in -- she sees the sarcophagus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emma scrambles in and Steed leaps on top of her, bringing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 3-2-1 -- and a BLAST like a nuclear EXPLOSION -- as the U fragmented to smithereens -- Emma's " coffin" goes flying OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beneath the clear moonlight, all bulbs on -- like Xmas.

dialogues.speaker: BELOW
dialogues.text: it floats the coffin -- which opens, revealing ... Steed and Emma, squashed together, gasping for breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'The owl and the pussycat went to sea -'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: '... in a beautiful pea green boat...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fine night, Mrs. Peel ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still a bit chilly ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: English weather. You know, after  all we've been through, I should  say we deserve a long holiday ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you any place in mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a matter of fact I have ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The coffin drifts downstream in the moonlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few weeks later.  Across snowy wastes, a pack of Huskie WHIP CRACKED by a -- Frozen fur-clad Siberian peasant.  As he turns a corner, snow into --

dialogues.speaker: SAND
dialogues.text: The peasant stops, stares.

dialogues.speaker: AHEAD OF HIM
dialogues.text: Sun beats down.  A tropical beach.  A warm sea.  A butler CHAMPAGNE CORK.  From a tent, he brings two glasses down

dialogues.speaker: TWO DIVAN-STYLE DECK CHAIRS
dialogues.text: Where Steed and Emma toast in the sun.  Steed in a smokin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't recall Siberia being this warm, Steed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the latest thing, Mrs. Peel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our little paradise -- just made for two?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks; frowns) Not quite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On cue from the water, Mother emerges, snorkeling in his with Brenda.  He waves to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our chaperon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pity your mother came, too ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed seems peeved that his chance to be alone with EMMA pours glasses of champagne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still a little warm, Trubshaw. Is this the '28? A little more ice, I think ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trubshaw trots off dutifully.  A large ice bucket appears by Emma, now his new protegee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About your next assignment, Mrs. Peel ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next assignment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steed gives his champagne to the Siberian peasant.  He pr shoots up between them, opens up, twirls. PULL BACK to reveal the strip of beach, like a tiny bubbl Against a Siberian b.g. of snow.  As we WIDEN we REVEAL a hearing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah ... sun tan lotion. Any shops nearby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be. Trubshaw's busy. I'll send Mother ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK to reveal no shop for miles around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahem. As I was saying, perhaps another macaroon ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Steed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Mrs. Peel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the umbrella -- LAUGHTER.  CHINK of GLASSES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FADE OUT.
